code: @Manual{,   title = {ggExametrika: Visualization of Exametrika Output using ggplot},   author = {Koji Kosugi and Daichi Kamimura},   year = {2025},   note = {R package version 0.0.9}, }

title: ggExametrika 開発方針
text: exametrikaパッケージの出力をggplot2で可視化するためのパッケージ。 CRAN公開を目指す。

title: ggExametrika 開発方針
text: 場所: ../exametrika/ 参照: https://kosugitti.github.io/Exametrika/

title: ggExametrika 開発方針
text: roxygen2によるドキュメント生成 testthatによるユニットテスト CRAN準拠のチェックをパスすること

title: ggExametrika 開発方針
text: plot関数: plot_*() または gg*() 形式を検討 内部関数: . prefix

title: ggExametrika 開発方針
text: ggplot2 (必須) gridExtra (複数プロット配置) exametrikaはSuggestsに入れる（CRAN対応のため）

title: ggExametrika 開発方針
text: R CMD check –-cran でWARNING/ERRORなし NEWS.mdの更新 DESCRIPTIONのバージョン更新 examplesの動作確認 ドキュメントの整備

title: ggExametrika 開発方針
text: exametrikaの全プロット機能をggplot2で実装完了したらv1.0とする。

id: 未実装機能v10までに実装予定

title: ggExametrika 開発方針
text: TRF (Test Response Function) CRV/RRV (Class/Rank Reference Vector) LDPSR (Latent Dependence Passing Student Rate) ScoreFreq (スコア頻度分布) ScoreRank (スコア-ランクヒートマップ) ICRP (Item Category Reference Profile) ICBR (Item Category Boundary Response) GRM対応 (IRF, IIF, TIF)

text: 作業ログは log.md に記録する。

what: Visualization of Exametrika Output using ggplot
title: Visualization of Exametrika Output using ggplot
text: Exametrika powerful tool developed Shojima(2022) data analysis, available Mathematica Excel Add-. developed R package https://kosugitti.github.io/Exametrika/. package, ggExametrika, built enhance visualization capabilities Exametrika pacakge using ggplot functions. integrates seamlessly Exametrika package, providing beautiful logically arranged plots simplified data interpretation R.

title: Visualization of Exametrika Output using ggplot
text: Shojima, Kojiro (2022) Test Data Engineering: Latent Rank Analysis, Biclustering, andBayesian Network (Behaviormetrics: Quantitative Approaches Human Behavior, 13), Springer, https://amzn./42eNArd

title: Visualization of Exametrika Output using ggplot
text: can install development version ggExametrika GitHub :
code: # install.packages("devtools") devtools::install_github("kosugitti/ggExametrika")

title: Visualization of Exametrika Output using ggplot
text: package, can create plots using ggplot2 directly inputting output results Exametrika. functions responsible generating plots named format plotxxx_gg. Additionally, options available display multiple plots.

title: Visualization of Exametrika Output using ggplot
text: plotICC_gg specifically designed output IRT. example code using Exametrika package. run code, need Exametrika package. want plot ICC, input stored results directly plotICC_gg function. can also specify range X-axis vector. specific range provided, plotted range -4 4, function return list. way, ICC item stored list called plots. want see figures, can specify follows. Also, want draw multiple figures simultaneously, can use combinePlots_gg() function.

title: Visualization of Exametrika Output using ggplot
text: can also plot Item Information Curve (IIC) similar plotICC_gg function. Input output Exametrika package plotIIC_gg function . method, IIC item stored list called plots. want view figures, can specify follows. Also, wish draw multiple figures simultaneously, can use combinePlots_gg() function.
code: plots <- plotIIC_gg(result.IRT) # If you wish to specify a range, please provide a vector for the xvariable argument. The x-axis does not necessarily have to be symmetric around 0 for plotting. # plotIIC_gg(result.IRT,xvariable = c(-5, 7)) # plotIIC_gg(result.IRT,xvariable = c(2, 9)) # Draw the IIC for Item8. plots[8] #> [[1]] # We will output multiple plots simultaneously (default is 6). This time, we will display 4 plots from the 8th to the 11th. combinePlots_gg(plots, selectPlots = c(8:11))

title: Visualization of Exametrika Output using ggplot
text: can also plot Test Information Curve using procedure. Subsequent functions may differences arguments, generally used way. input data plotting function fit model, error occur, please check compatibility model plotting function. Since dealing information curve single test time, one plot generated.
code: plot <- plotTIC_gg(result.IRT) # If you wish to specify a range, please provide a vector for the xvariable argument. The x-axis does not necessarily have to be symmetric around 0 for plotting. # Draw the IIC for Item8. plot

title: ggExametrika 開発ログ
text: claude.md（開発方針）とlog.md（作業ログ）を作成 .Rbuildignoreにclaude.md、log.md、README.Rmdを追加 DESCRIPTIONのSuggestsにExametrikaを追加

id: 致命的な問題-クラス名の大文字小文字
what: 致命的な問題: クラス名の大文字/小文字
title: ggExametrika 開発ログ
text: ggExametrikaは "Exametrika" (大文字E)をチェックしているが、 現在のexametrikaは "exametrika" (小文字e)を使用。 影響を受ける関数（全関数）: - plotICC_gg: class(data) %% c("Exametrika", "IRT") → 動作しない - plotIIC_gg: 同上 - plotTIC_gg: 同上 - plotIRP_gg: c("Exametrika", "LCA"), c("Exametrika", "LRA"), c("Exametrika", "LDLRA") → 動作しない - plotFRP_gg: c("Exametrika", "Biclustering"), etc. → 動作しない - plotTRP_gg: 同上 - plotLCD_gg: 同上 - plotLRD_gg: 同上 - plotCMP_gg: 同上 - plotRMP_gg: 同上 - plotArray_gg: 同上 - plotFieldPIRP_gg: 同上

title: ggExametrika 開発ログ
text: 全ての "Exametrika" を "exametrika" に変更する必要あり。

id: exametrikaの現在の出力構造確認済み
what: exametrikaの現在の出力構造（確認済み）
title: ggExametrika 開発ログ
text: 注意: 新しいexametrikaは一部で命名規則を変更中 - Nclass → n_class (後方互換性のため両方存在) - Nrank → n_rank - N_Cycle → n_cycle ggExametrikaが使用している Nclass, Nrank などは後方互換性フィールドとして残っているため、フィールドアクセス自体は問題なし。

title: ggExametrika 開発ログ
text: 全Rファイルで "Exametrika" → "exametrika" に修正: - R/ICCtoTIC.R - R/IRPtoCMPRMP.R - R/arraytoLDPSR.R

title: ggExametrika 開発ログ
text: _pkgdown.yml 作成（サイト設定、リファレンス構成） .github/workflows/pkgdown.yaml 作成（GitHub Actions自動デプロイ） .Rbuildignore に pkgdown関連を追加 DESCRIPTIONのSuggests: Exametrika → exametrika (CRANパッケージ名は小文字) GitHub Pages有効化完了 サイト公開: https://kosugitti.github.io/ggExametrika/

title: ggExametrika 開発ログ
text: styler::style_pkg() を適用 README.Rmd の library(Exametrika) → library(exametrika) に修正 README.md を再生成

id: ヘルプドキュメント拡充
what: ヘルプドキュメント拡充
title: ggExametrika 開発ログ
text: 全関数に @return, @details, @examples, @seealso を追加 @seealso はパッケージ内の関数のみを参照（外部参照は削除） R/ICCtoTIC.R: plotICC_gg, LogisticModel, ItemInformationFunc, plotIIC_gg, plotTIC_gg R/IRPtoCMPRMP.R: plotIRP_gg, plotFRP_gg, plotTRP_gg, plotLCD_gg, plotLRD_gg, plotCMP_gg, plotRMP_gg R/arraytoLDPSR.R: plotArray_gg, plotFieldPIRP_gg R/option.R: combinePlots_gg devtools::document() で man/*.Rd ファイル更新（15ファイル） styler::style_pkg() で再フォーマット

title: Item Information Function for 4PLM — ItemInformationFunc
text: Computes Item Information Function (IIF) four-parameter logistic model Item Response Theory. information function indicates precisely item measures ability different theta levels.

title: Item Information Function for 4PLM — ItemInformationFunc
code: ItemInformationFunc(x, a = 1, b, c = 0, d = 1)

title: Item Information Function for 4PLM — ItemInformationFunc
text: x Numeric. ability parameter (theta). Numeric. slope (discrimination) parameter. Default 1. b Numeric. location (difficulty) parameter. c Numeric. lower asymptote (guessing) parameter. Default 0. d Numeric. upper asymptote (carelessness) parameter. Default 1.

title: Item Information Function for 4PLM — ItemInformationFunc
text: numeric value representing item information given ability level.

title: Item Information Function for 4PLM — ItemInformationFunc
text: Higher discrimination () parameters result higher information. Items provide maximum information near difficulty (b) parameter. guessing (c) upper asymptote (d) parameters reduce maximum information item can provide.

title: Item Information Function for 4PLM — ItemInformationFunc
code: # Information at ability = 0 for an item with b = 0 ItemInformationFunc(x = 0, a = 1.5, b = 0, c = 0, d = 1) #> [1] 0.5625  # Compare information at different ability levels sapply(seq(-3, 3, 0.5), function(x) ItemInformationFunc(x, a = 1, b = 0)) #>  [1] 0.04517666 0.07010372 0.10499359 0.14914645 0.19661193 0.23500371 #>  [7] 0.25000000 0.23500371 0.19661193 0.14914645 0.10499359 0.07010372 #> [13] 0.04517666

title: Four-Parameter Logistic Model — LogisticModel
text: Computes probability correct response using four-parameter logistic model (4PLM) Item Response Theory.

title: Four-Parameter Logistic Model — LogisticModel
code: LogisticModel(x, a = 1, b, c = 0, d = 1)

title: Four-Parameter Logistic Model — LogisticModel
text: x Numeric. ability parameter (theta). Numeric. slope (discrimination) parameter. Default 1. b Numeric. location (difficulty) parameter. c Numeric. lower asymptote (guessing) parameter. Default 0. d Numeric. upper asymptote (carelessness) parameter. Default 1.

title: Four-Parameter Logistic Model — LogisticModel
text: numeric value representing probability correct response.

title: Four-Parameter Logistic Model — LogisticModel
text: four-parameter logistic model extends 3PLM adding upper asymptote parameter d, accounts careless errors high-ability examinees. model formula : $$P(\theta) = c + \frac{d - c}{1 + \exp(-(\theta - b))}$$ Special cases: 1PLM: = 1, c = 0, d = 1 2PLM: c = 0, d = 1 3PLM: d = 1

title: Four-Parameter Logistic Model — LogisticModel
code: # Compute probability for ability = 0, difficulty = 0 LogisticModel(x = 0, a = 1, b = 0, c = 0, d = 1)  # Returns 0.5 #> [1] 0.5  # 3PLM with guessing parameter LogisticModel(x = -3, a = 1.5, b = 0, c = 0.2, d = 1) #> [1] 0.2087896

what: Display Multiple Plots Simultaneously from ggExametrika Output — combinePlots_gg
title: Display Multiple Plots Simultaneously from ggExametrika Output — combinePlots_gg
text: function arranges multiple ggplot objects ggExametrika functions single display using grid layout. Useful comparing plots across items students.

title: Display Multiple Plots Simultaneously from ggExametrika Output — combinePlots_gg
code: combinePlots_gg(plots, selectPlots = c(1:6))

title: Display Multiple Plots Simultaneously from ggExametrika Output — combinePlots_gg
text: plots list ggplot objects, typically output functions like plotICC_gg, plotIRP_gg, etc. selectPlots numeric vector specifying plots display. Default 1:6 (first 6 plots). Indices exceeding list length automatically excluded.

title: Display Multiple Plots Simultaneously from ggExametrika Output — combinePlots_gg
text: gtable object containing arranged plots, displayed side effect.

title: Display Multiple Plots Simultaneously from ggExametrika Output — combinePlots_gg
text: function uses gridExtra::grid.arrange combine multiple plots. number rows columns automatically determined. control layout, consider using gridExtra::grid.arrange directly nrow ncol arguments.

title: Display Multiple Plots Simultaneously from ggExametrika Output — combinePlots_gg
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ library(exametrika) result <- IRT(J15S500, model = 3) plots <- plotICC_gg(result) combinePlots_gg(plots, selectPlots = 1:6)  # Show first 6 items combinePlots_gg(plots, selectPlots = c(1, 5, 10))  # Show specific items } # }

title: Plot Array from exametrika — plotArray_gg
text: function takes exametrika output input generates array plots using ggplot2. Array plots visualize response patterns students (rows) across items (columns), showing original data clustered/reordered data.

title: Plot Array from exametrika — plotArray_gg
code: plotArray_gg(   data,   Original = TRUE,   Clusterd = TRUE,   Clusterd_lines = TRUE,   title = TRUE )

title: Plot Array from exametrika — plotArray_gg
text: data object class c("exametrika", "Biclustering"), c("exametrika", "IRM"), c("exametrika", "LDB"), c("exametrika", "BINET"). Original Logical. TRUE (default), plot original (unsorted) response data. Clusterd Logical. TRUE (default), plot clustered (sorted class field) response data. Clusterd_lines Logical. TRUE (default), draw red lines clustered plot indicate class field boundaries. title Logical. TRUE (default), display plot titles.

title: Plot Array from exametrika — plotArray_gg
text: ggplot object grid arrangement two ggplot objects (original clustered plots side side).

title: Plot Array from exametrika — plotArray_gg
text: array plot provides visual representation biclustering result. Black cells indicate correct responses (1), white cells indicate incorrect responses (0). well-fitted model, clustered plot show clear block diagonal pattern high-ability students (bottom rows) answer difficult items (right columns) correctly.

title: Plot Array from exametrika — plotArray_gg
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ library(exametrika) result <- Biclustering(J35S515, nfld = 5, ncls = 6) plotArray_gg(result) } # }

what: Plot Class Membership Profile (CMP) from exametrika — plotCMP_gg
title: Plot Class Membership Profile (CMP) from exametrika — plotCMP_gg
text: function takes exametrika output input generates Class Membership Profile (CMP) plots using ggplot2. CMP shows student's membership probability across latent classes.

title: Plot Class Membership Profile (CMP) from exametrika — plotCMP_gg
code: plotCMP_gg(data)

title: Plot Class Membership Profile (CMP) from exametrika — plotCMP_gg
text: data object class c("exametrika", "LCA") c("exametrika", "BINET"). LRA, Biclustering, LDLRA, LDB output provided, RMP plotted instead warning.

title: Plot Class Membership Profile (CMP) from exametrika — plotCMP_gg
text: list ggplot objects, one student. plot shows membership probability across latent classes.

title: Plot Class Membership Profile (CMP) from exametrika — plotCMP_gg
text: Class Membership Profile visualizes strongly student belongs latent class. Students high membership probability single class well-classified, students similar probabilities across classes may ambiguous cases.

title: Plot Class Membership Profile (CMP) from exametrika — plotCMP_gg
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ library(exametrika) result <- LCA(J15S500, ncls = 5) plots <- plotCMP_gg(result) plots[[1]]  # Show CMP for the first student } # }

what: Plot Field Reference Profile (FRP) from exametrika — plotFRP_gg
title: Plot Field Reference Profile (FRP) from exametrika — plotFRP_gg
text: function takes exametrika output input generates Field Reference Profile (FRP) plots using ggplot2. FRP shows correct response rate field (item cluster) latent class rank level.

title: Plot Field Reference Profile (FRP) from exametrika — plotFRP_gg
code: plotFRP_gg(data)

title: Plot Field Reference Profile (FRP) from exametrika — plotFRP_gg
text: data object class c("exametrika", "Biclustering"), c("exametrika", "IRM"), c("exametrika", "LDB"), c("exametrika", "BINET").

title: Plot Field Reference Profile (FRP) from exametrika — plotFRP_gg
text: list ggplot objects, one field. plot shows correct response rate across latent classes ranks.

title: Plot Field Reference Profile (FRP) from exametrika — plotFRP_gg
text: biclustering models, items grouped fields. Field Reference Profile shows field's correct response rate varies across latent classes ranks. Fields monotonically increasing profiles indicate good alignment latent structure.

title: Plot Field Reference Profile (FRP) from exametrika — plotFRP_gg
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ library(exametrika) result <- Biclustering(J35S515, nfld = 5, ncls = 6) plots <- plotFRP_gg(result) plots[[1]]  # Show FRP for the first field } # }

what: Plot Field PIRP (Parent Item Reference Profile) from exametrika — plotFieldPIRP_gg
title: Plot Field PIRP (Parent Item Reference Profile) from exametrika — plotFieldPIRP_gg
text: function takes exametrika LDB output input generates Field PIRP (Parent Item Reference Profile) plots using ggplot2. Field PIRP shows correct response rate field function number-right score parent fields.

title: Plot Field PIRP (Parent Item Reference Profile) from exametrika — plotFieldPIRP_gg
code: plotFieldPIRP_gg(data)

title: Plot Field PIRP (Parent Item Reference Profile) from exametrika — plotFieldPIRP_gg
text: data object class c("exametrika", "LDB").

title: Plot Field PIRP (Parent Item Reference Profile) from exametrika — plotFieldPIRP_gg
text: list ggplot objects, one rank. plot shows correct response rate curves fields rank level.

title: Plot Field PIRP (Parent Item Reference Profile) from exametrika — plotFieldPIRP_gg
text: Local Dependence Biclustering (LDB), items field may depend performance parent fields. Field PIRP visualizes dependency showing correct response rate field changes based number correct responses parent fields. Note: Warning messages NA values may appear plotting behavior normal.

title: Plot Field PIRP (Parent Item Reference Profile) from exametrika — plotFieldPIRP_gg
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ library(exametrika) result <- LDB(J35S515, nfld = 5, ncls = 6) plots <- plotFieldPIRP_gg(result) plots[[1]]  # Show Field PIRP for rank 1 } # }

what: Plot Item Characteristic Curves (ICC) from exametrika — plotICC_gg
title: Plot Item Characteristic Curves (ICC) from exametrika — plotICC_gg
text: function takes exametrika IRT output input generates Item Characteristic Curves (ICC) using ggplot2. ICC shows probability correct response function ability (theta).

title: Plot Item Characteristic Curves (ICC) from exametrika — plotICC_gg
code: plotICC_gg(data, xvariable = c(-4, 4))

title: Plot Item Characteristic Curves (ICC) from exametrika — plotICC_gg
text: data object class c("exametrika", "IRT") exametrika::IRT(). xvariable numeric vector length 2 specifying range x-axis (ability). Default c(-4, 4).

title: Plot Item Characteristic Curves (ICC) from exametrika — plotICC_gg
text: list ggplot objects, one item. plot shows Item Characteristic Curve item.

title: Plot Item Characteristic Curves (ICC) from exametrika — plotICC_gg
text: function supports 2PL, 3PL, 4PL IRT models: 2PL: slope () location (b) parameters 3PL: adds lower asymptote (c) parameter 4PL: adds upper asymptote (d) parameter ICC computed using four-parameter logistic model: $$P(\theta) = c + \frac{d - c}{1 + \exp(-(\theta - b))}$$

title: Plot Item Characteristic Curves (ICC) from exametrika — plotICC_gg
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ library(exametrika) result <- IRT(J15S500, model = 3) plots <- plotICC_gg(result) plots[[1]]  # Show ICC for the first item combinePlots_gg(plots, selectPlots = 1:6)  # Show first 6 items } # }

what: Plot Item Information Curves (IIC) from exametrika — plotIIC_gg
title: Plot Item Information Curves (IIC) from exametrika — plotIIC_gg
text: function takes exametrika IRT output input generates Item Information Curves (IIC) using ggplot2. IIC shows much information item provides different ability levels.

title: Plot Item Information Curves (IIC) from exametrika — plotIIC_gg
code: plotIIC_gg(data, xvariable = c(-4, 4))

title: Plot Item Information Curves (IIC) from exametrika — plotIIC_gg
text: data object class c("exametrika", "IRT") exametrika::IRT(). xvariable numeric vector length 2 specifying range x-axis (ability). Default c(-4, 4).

title: Plot Item Information Curves (IIC) from exametrika — plotIIC_gg
text: list ggplot objects, one item. plot shows Item Information Curve item.

title: Plot Item Information Curves (IIC) from exametrika — plotIIC_gg
text: Item Information Function indicates precisely item measures ability point theta scale. Items higher discrimination parameters provide information. peak information curve occurs near item's difficulty parameter. function supports 2PL, 3PL, 4PL IRT models.

title: Plot Item Information Curves (IIC) from exametrika — plotIIC_gg
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ library(exametrika) result <- IRT(J15S500, model = 3) plots <- plotIIC_gg(result) plots[[1]]  # Show IIC for the first item combinePlots_gg(plots, selectPlots = 1:6)  # Show first 6 items } # }

what: Plot Item Reference Profile (IRP) from exametrika — plotIRP_gg
title: Plot Item Reference Profile (IRP) from exametrika — plotIRP_gg

title: Plot Item Reference Profile (IRP) from exametrika — plotIRP_gg
code: plotIRP_gg(data)

title: Plot Item Reference Profile (IRP) from exametrika — plotIRP_gg

code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ library(exametrika) result <- LRA(J15S500, nrank = 5) plots <- plotIRP_gg(result) plots[[1]]  # Show IRP for the first item } # }

Num_Students Logical. TRUE (default), display number students bar. title Logical. TRUE (default), display plot title.

text: list ggplot objects, one student. plot shows membership probability across latent ranks.

title: Plot Rank Membership Profile (RMP) from exametrika — plotRMP_gg
text: Rank Membership Profile visualizes strongly student belongs latent rank. Unlike class membership, rank membership ordinal interpretation. Students unimodal profiles centered single rank well-classified.

title: Plot Rank Membership Profile (RMP) from exametrika — plotRMP_gg
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ library(exametrika) result <- LRA(J15S500, nrank = 5) plots <- plotRMP_gg(result) plots[[1]]  # Show RMP for the first student } # }

what: Plot Test Information Curve (TIC) from exametrika — plotTIC_gg
title: Plot Test Information Curve (TIC) from exametrika — plotTIC_gg
text: function takes exametrika IRT output input generates Test Information Curve (TIC) using ggplot2. TIC shows total information provided items ability level.

title: Plot Test Information Curve (TIC) from exametrika — plotTIC_gg
code: plotTIC_gg(data, xvariable = c(-4, 4))

title: Plot Test Information Curve (TIC) from exametrika — plotTIC_gg
text: data object class c("exametrika", "IRT") exametrika::IRT(). xvariable numeric vector length 2 specifying range x-axis (ability). Default c(-4, 4).

title: Plot Test Information Curve (TIC) from exametrika — plotTIC_gg
text: single ggplot object showing Test Information Curve.

title: Plot Test Information Curve (TIC) from exametrika — plotTIC_gg
text: Test Information Function sum Item Information Functions. indicates precisely test whole measures ability point theta scale. reciprocal test information approximately equal squared standard error measurement. function supports 2PL, 3PL, 4PL IRT models.

title: Plot Test Information Curve (TIC) from exametrika — plotTIC_gg
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ library(exametrika) result <- IRT(J15S500, model = 3) plot <- plotTIC_gg(result) plot  # Show Test Information Curve } # }

what: Plot Test Reference Profile (TRP) from exametrika — plotTRP_gg
title: Plot Test Reference Profile (TRP) from exametrika — plotTRP_gg
text: function takes exametrika output input generates Test Reference Profile (TRP) plot using ggplot2. TRP shows number students latent class/rank (bar graph) expected test score class/rank (line graph).

title: Plot Test Reference Profile (TRP) from exametrika — plotTRP_gg
code: plotTRP_gg(data, Num_Students = TRUE, title = TRUE)

title: Plot Test Reference Profile (TRP) from exametrika — plotTRP_gg
text: data object exametrika: LCA, LRA, Biclustering, IRM, LDB, BINET output. Num_Students Logical. TRUE (default), display number students bar. title Logical. TRUE (default), display plot title.

title: Plot Test Reference Profile (TRP) from exametrika — plotTRP_gg
text: single ggplot object dual y-axes showing student distribution expected scores.

title: Plot Test Reference Profile (TRP) from exametrika — plotTRP_gg
text: Test Reference Profile provides overview latent structure. bar graph shows students distributed across classes/ranks, line graph shows expected test score class/rank. well-fitted models, expected scores increase monotonically class/rank number.
